intro: Galaxia, commonly known as the star flower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Geraniaceae. It is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white, pink, and red. The leaves are usually opposite, simple, and often have a slightly serrated edge. Galaxia species are native to temperate regions of the Southern Hemisphere, including South America, Africa, and Australia.
